graph2D

Class Graph2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
      • graph2D.Graph2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.WindowFocusListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.WindowStateListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Plotter

    public class Graph2D
extends java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
    Graph2D let users work with a graphic space for drawing points, lines, polylines, polygons, arcs and filled arcs.
    Version:
    (Ac. year. 2018-19, 1.3)
    Author:
    (CC-BY-NC-SA. IIP, PRG, EDA @ ETSINF-UPV. pmarques)

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Background Color (WHITE).
      static java.awt.Font DEF_FONT
      The, by default, Font for drawing Strings.

      The, by default, thickness of lines and points.
      static java.awt.Color FOR_1
      Foreground Color 1 (BLACK).
      static java.awt.Color FOR_2
      Foreground Color 2 (BLUE).

      Initial graph height in pixels.
      static int INI_WIDTH
      Initial graph width in pixels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph2D()
      The by default constructor creates a squared working space for x in [-1.0 .. +1.0] and y in [-1.0 .. +1.0].
      Graph2D(double mX, double xX, double mY, double xY)
      Creates a Graph2D with real dimensions and default window dimensions, background color and title.
      Graph2D(double mX, double xX, double mY, double xY, int wWidth, int wHeight)
      Creates a Graph2D with real and window dimensions, with default background color and title.
      Graph2D(double mX, double xX, double mY, double xY, int wWidth, int wHeight, java.awt.Color bckCol, java.lang.String t)
      Creates a Graph2D with real dimensions, window dimensions, bckCol color and t title.

      Draws a point given its real (x,y) coordinates.

      Draws a point with Color c and th thickness, given its real (x,y) coordinates.

      Draws an open (not closed) polygonal line with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index.

      Draws an open (not closed) polygonal line with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index.

      Draws a String with the baseline of the leftmost character at position (x, y), with Color c and Font f.

      void fillOval(double x, double y, double w, double h)
      Paints a coloured oval inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), with default thickness and Color.

      Paints (fills) a coloured oval inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), Color c and thickness th.
      void fillPolygon(double[] xCoords, double[] yCoords)
      Paints an closed (coloured filled) polygon with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index.

      • Graph2D

        public Graph2D(double mX,
               double xX,
               double mY,
               double xY)
        throws java.awt.image.ImagingOpException
        Creates a Graph2D with real dimensions and default window dimensions, background color and title.
        Parameters:
        mX: - double. Minimum x-coordinate value, mX < xX.
        xX: - double. Maximum x-coordinate value, mX < xX.
        mY: - double. Minimum y-coordinate value, mY < xY.
        xY: - double. Maximum y-coordinate value, mY < xY.
        Throws:
        java.awt.image.ImagingOpException

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all elements, reestablishing background color and, possibly, axes and mouse position.

      • drawArc

        public void drawArc(double x,
                    double y,
                    double w,
                    double h,
                    int sA,
                    int aA)
        Draws an arc inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), its width w and height h. The arc starts at angle sA with arc angle sA. Angles are expressed in degrees with clockwise direction. Negative angles mean anticlockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the arc.
        h: - height of the rectangle including the arc.
        sA: - int. start angle in degrees (clockwise).
        aA: - int. arc angle in degrees (clockwise).

      • drawArc

        public void drawArc(double x,
                    double y,
                    double w,
                    double h,
                    int sA,
                    int aA,
                    java.awt.Color c,
                    int th)
        Draws an arc inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), its width w and height h. The arc starts at angle sA with arc angle sA. Angles are expressed in degrees with clockwise direction. Negative angles mean anticlockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the arc.
        h: - height of the rectangle including the arc.
        sA: - int. start angle in degrees (clockwise).
        aA: - int. arc angle in degrees (clockwise).
        c: - Color of the arc line.
        th: - int, thickness of the arc line.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(double x1,
                     double y1,
                     double x2,
                     double y2)
        Draws a line between (x1,y1) and (x2,y2). Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        x1: - The abscise value of the first point.
        y1: - The ordinate value of the first point.
        x2: - The abscise value of the second point.
        y2: - The ordinate value of the second point.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(double x1,
                     double y1,
                     double x2,
                     double y2,
                     java.awt.Color c,
                     int th)
        Draws a line between (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) with Color c and th thickness. Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        x1: - The abscise value of the first point.
        y1: - The ordinate value of the first point.
        x2: - The abscise value of the second point.
        y2: - The ordinate value of the second point.
        c: - Color of the line.
        th: - int, the thickness of the line.

        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the oval.

      • drawPolyline

        public void drawPolyline(double[] xCoords,
                         double[] yCoords)
        Draws an open (not closed) polygonal line with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index. Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        xCoords: - Array with abscise values of the points.
        yCoords: - Array with ordinate values of the points.

      • drawPolyline

        public void drawPolyline(double[] xCoords,
                         double[] yCoords,
                         java.awt.Color c,
                         int th)
        Draws an open (not closed) polygonal line with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index. Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        xCoords: - Array with abscise values of the points.
        yCoords: - Array with ordinate values of the points.
        c: - Color of the polygonal line.
        th: - int, the thickness of the poligonal line.

      • fillArc

        public void fillArc(double x,
                    double y,
                    double w,
                    double h,
                    int sA,
                    int aA)
        Paints a filled arc (coloured) inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), width w and height h. The arc starts at angle sA with arc angle sA. Angles are expressed in degrees with clockwise direction. Negative angles mean anticlockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the arc.
        h: - height of the rectangle including the arc.
        sA: - int. start angle in degrees (clockwise).
        aA: - int. arc angle in degrees (clockwise).

      • fillArc

        public void fillArc(double x,
                    double y,
                    double w,
                    double h,
                    int sA,
                    int aA,
                    java.awt.Color c,
                    int th)
        Draws a filled arc (coloured) inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), width w and height h. The arc starts at angle sA with arc angle sA. Angles are expressed in degrees with clockwise direction. Negative angles mean anticlockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the arc.
        h: - height of the rectangle including the arc.
        sA: - int. start angle in degrees (clockwise).
        aA: - int. arc angle in degrees (clockwise).
        c: - Color of the filled arc.
        th: - int, thickness of the filled arc.

      • fillOval

        public void fillOval(double x,
                     double y,
                     double w,
                     double h)
        Paints a coloured oval inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), with default thickness and Color.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the oval.
        h: - height of the rectangle including the oval.

      • fillOval

        public void fillOval(double x,
                     double y,
                     double w,
                     double h,
                     java.awt.Color c,
                     int th)
        Paints (fills) a coloured oval inclosed in a rectangular area given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y), Color c and thickness th.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle including the oval.
        h: - height of the rectangle including the oval.
        c: - Color of the oval.
        th: - int, thickness of the oval.

      • fillPolygon

        public void fillPolygon(double[] xCoords,
                        double[] yCoords)
        Paints an closed (coloured filled) polygon with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index. Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        xCoords: - Array with abscise values of the points.
        yCoords: - Array with ordinate values of the points.

      • fillPolygon

        public void fillPolygon(double[] xCoords,
                        double[] yCoords,
                        java.awt.Color c,
                        int th)
        Paints an closed (coloured filled) polygon with points defined in the arrays xCoords, and yCoords with same index. Works in the real graphic space.
        Parameters:
        xCoords: - Array with abscise values of the points.
        yCoords: - Array with ordinate values of the points.
        c: - Color of the polygon line.
        th: - int, the thickness of the lines of the polygon.

      • fillRect

        public void fillRect(double x,
                     double y,
                     double w,
                     double h)
        Paints (fills) a rectangle as given by the coordinate of its upper left corner (x,y) and its width w and height h.
        Parameters:
        x: - The abscise of the upper left corner.
        y: - The ordinate of the upper left corner.
        w: - width of the rectangle.
        h: - height of the rectangle.

      • lastMousePressed

        public double[] lastMousePressed()
        Returns the last pressed mouse position in real coordinates.
        Returns:
        double[] 2-elements array: a[0] the x-coordinate and a[1] the y-coordinate.

      • nextMousePressed

        public double[] nextMousePressed()
        Waits for the next mouse click (mousePressed event) and returns the mouse pressed position in real coordinates.
        Returns:
        double[] 2-elements array: a[0] the x-coordinate and a[1] the y-coordinate.

      • setFont

        public void setFont(java.awt.Font f)
        Set the Font f for drawing Strings from now on.
        Parameters:
        th - int: Thickness elements to be drawed.

      • setForegroundColor

        public void setForegroundColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Set foreground Color c, for drawing from now on.
        Parameters:
        c: - The foreground Color.

      • setGraphDimensions

        public void setGraphDimensions(double miX,
                               double maX,
                               double miY,
                               double maY)
        Modify the real graph dimensions with a new x-interval [miX .. maX] and a new y-interval [miY .. maY]. For doing so it modifies the internal Affine Tranformation calculus used for converting real space coordinates into user's (internal) one.
        Parameters:
        miX: - Minimum x value to be represented, miX < maX.
        maX: - Maximum x value to be represented, miX < maX.
        miY: - Minimum y value to be represented, miY < maY.
        maY: - Maximum y value to be represented, miY < maY.

      • setResizable

        public void setResizable(boolean sR)
        Makes the Graphic window resizable or not.
        Parameters:
        sR: - Boolean, true iff window is resizable.

      • setThickness

        public void setThickness(int th)
        Set lines and points thickness th for drawing from now on.
        Parameters:
        th - int: Thickness elements to be drawed.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String tit)
        Sets the title of the graph window.
        Parameters:
        tit - String: the title of the graph window.

      • setXRange

        public void setXRange(double miX,
                      double maX)
        Modify the real graph dimensions with a new x-interval [miX .. maX]. The y-interval remains unaltered.
        Parameters:
        miX: - Minimum x value to be represented, miX < maX.
        maX: - Maximum x value to be represented, miX < maX.

      • setYRange

        public void setYRange(double miY,
                      double maY)
        Modify the real graph dimensions with a new y-interval [miY .. maY]. The x-interval remains unaltered.
        Parameters:
        miY: - Minimum y value to be represented, miY < maY.
        maY: - Maximum y value to be represented, miY < maY.

      • showAxes

        public void showAxes(boolean opt)
        Set drawing axes on (true by default) or off (false).
        Parameters:
        opt: - Axes will be drawn iff opt is true.

      • showMousePosition

        public void showMousePosition(boolean opt)
        Set showing mouse position on (true by default) or off (false).
        Parameters:
        opt: - Mouse pos. will be showed iff opt is true

      • windowClosing

        public void windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)
        Closing sequence whenever this graph window is closed. Not to be called by the user.
        Specified by:
        windowClosing in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
        Overrides:
        windowClosing in class java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
